memberdef.argsstring: (const ScalarType dividend, const ScalarType divisor)
memberdef.name: computeModulo

briefdescription.para: Compute modulo of floating-point number (default double).

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the remainder of division of one floating-point number by another. The modulo computation is based on the mathematical definition of congruence, which is different from the implementation of std::fmod() in the cmath standard library. For a description of congruence see: http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Congruence.html. The remainder is in the range [ 0, divisor ).
dividend
Number to be divided.
divisor
Number that is divided by.
Remainder of division of dividend by divisor.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ScalarType dividend, const ScalarType divisor, ScalarType &moduloValue, int &numberOfDivisors)
memberdef.name: computeModuloAndRemainder

briefdescription.para: Compute modulo of floating-point number (default double).

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the remainder of division of one floating-point number by another. The modulo computation is based on the mathematical definition of congruence, which is different from the implementation of std::fmod() in the cmath standard library. For a description of congruence see: http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Congruence.html. The remainder is in the range [ 0, divisor ). This function also returns (by reference) the number of times divisor goes into dividend, i.e. the division from which the moduloValue is the remainder.
dividend
Number to be divided.
divisor
Number that is divided by.
moduloValue
Remainder of division of dividend by divisor (returned by reference).
numberOfDivisors
Number of times divisor goes into dividend (returned by reference).

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const int order, LegendreCache &legendreCache)
memberdef.name: computeLegendrePolynomialFromCache

briefdescription.para: Compute unnormalized associated Legendre polynomial.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns an unnormalized associated Legendre polynomial $ P _{ n, m }( u ) $ with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $. $ P _{ n, m }( u ) $ obeys the definition given by Vallado [2001]: \[ P _{ n, m } ( u ) = ( 1 - u ^ 2 ) ^ { m / 2 } \frac{ d ^ m }{ du ^ m } \left[ P_n ( u ) \right] \textrm{ for }n \geq 0, 0 \leq m \leq n \] in which $ P_{ n, m }( u ) $ is the ordinary Legendre polynomial with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $.
For $ n \geq 0, m \geq n $ the $ P _{ n, m }( u ) $ has been defined here as follows: \[ P _{ n, m } ( u ) = 0 \textrm{ for }n \geq 0, m \geq n \]

This function has been optimized for repeated calls with varying 'degree' and 'order' arguments (but with identical 'polynomialParameter' argument). To this end the function maintains a back-end cache with intermediate results which is automatically carried over between calls.
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial.
order
Order of requested Legendre polynomial.
legendreCache
Legendre cache from which to retrieve Legendre polynomial.
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const int order, const double legendreParameter)
memberdef.name: computeLegendrePolynomial

briefdescription.para: Compute unnormalized associated Legendre polynomial.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns an unnormalized associated Legendre polynomial $ P _{ n, m }( u ) $ with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $. $ P _{ n, m }( u ) $ obeys the definition given by Vallado [2001]: \[ P _{ n, m } ( u ) = ( 1 - u ^ 2 ) ^ { m / 2 } \frac{ d ^ m }{ du ^ m } \left[ P_n ( u ) \right] \textrm{ for }n \geq 0, 0 \leq m \leq n \] in which $ P_{ n, m }( u ) $ is the ordinary Legendre polynomial with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $.
For $ n \geq 0, m \geq n $ the $ P _{ n, m }( u ) $ has been defined here as follows: \[ P _{ n, m } ( u ) = 0 \textrm{ for }n \geq 0, m \geq n \]

This function has been optimized for repeated calls with varying 'degree' and 'order' arguments (but with identical 'polynomialParameter' argument). To this end the function maintains a back-end cache with intermediate results which is automatically carried over between calls.
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial.
order
Order of requested Legendre polynomial.
legendreParameter
Free variable of requested Legendre polynomial.
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const int order, LegendreCache &geodesyLegendreCache)
memberdef.name: computeGeodesyLegendrePolynomialFromCache

briefdescription.para: Compute geodesy-normalized associated Legendre polynomial.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns a normalized associated Legendre polynomial $ \bar{ P }_{ n, m }( u ) $ with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $. The normalization obeys the definition: \[ \bar{ P }_{ n, m } ( u ) = \Pi_{ n, m } P_{ n, m } ( u ) \] in which $ \Pi_{ n, m } $ is the normalization factor which is commonly used in geodesy and is given by Heiskanen & Moritz [1967] as: \[ \Pi_{ n, m } = \sqrt{ \frac{ ( 2 - \delta_{ 0, m } ) ( 2 n + 1 ) ( n - m )! } { ( n + m )! } } \] in which $ n $ is the degree, $ m $ is the order and $ \delta_{ 0, m } $ is the Kronecker delta.

$ P _{ n, m }( u ) $ obeys the definition given by Vallado [2001]: \[ P _{ n, m } ( u ) = ( 1 - u ^ 2 ) ^ { m / 2 } \frac{ d ^ m }{ du ^ m } \left[ P_n ( u ) \right] \] in which $ P_{ n, m }( u ) $ is the ordinary Legendre polynomial with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $.
For $ n \geq 0, m \geq n $ the $ P _{ n, m }( u ) $ has been defined here as follows: \[ P _{ n, m } ( u ) = 0 \textrm{ for }n \geq 0, m \geq n \]

This function has been optimized for repeated calls with varying 'degree' and 'order' arguments (but with identical 'polynomialParameter' argument). To this end the function maintains a back-end cache with intermediate results which is automatically carried over between calls.
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial.
order
Order of requested Legendre polynomial.
geodesyLegendreCache
Legendre cache from which to retrieve Legendre polynomial.
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const int order, const double legendreParameter)
memberdef.name: computeGeodesyLegendrePolynomial

briefdescription.para: Compute geodesy-normalized associated Legendre polynomial.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns a normalized associated Legendre polynomial $ \bar{ P }_{ n, m }( u ) $ with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $. The normalization obeys the definition: \[ \bar{ P }_{ n, m } ( u ) = \Pi_{ n, m } P_{ n, m } ( u ) \] in which $ \Pi_{ n, m } $ is the normalization factor which is commonly used in geodesy and is given by Heiskanen & Moritz [1967] as: \[ \Pi_{ n, m } = \sqrt{ \frac{ ( 2 - \delta_{ 0, m } ) ( 2 n + 1 ) ( n - m )! } { ( n + m )! } } \] in which $ n $ is the degree, $ m $ is the order and $ \delta_{ 0, m } $ is the Kronecker delta.

$ P _{ n, m }( u ) $ obeys the definition given by Vallado [2001]: \[ P _{ n, m } ( u ) = ( 1 - u ^ 2 ) ^ { m / 2 } \frac{ d ^ m }{ du ^ m } \left[ P_n ( u ) \right] \] in which $ P_{ n, m }( u ) $ is the ordinary Legendre polynomial with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $.
For $ n \geq 0, m \geq n $ the $ P _{ n, m }( u ) $ has been defined here as follows: \[ P _{ n, m } ( u ) = 0 \textrm{ for }n \geq 0, m \geq n \]

This function has been optimized for repeated calls with varying 'degree' and 'order' arguments (but with identical 'polynomialParameter' argument). To this end the function maintains a back-end cache with intermediate results which is automatically carried over between calls.
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial.
order
Order of requested Legendre polynomial.
legendreParameter
Free variable of requested Legendre polynomial.
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int order, const double polynomialParameter, const double currentLegendrePolynomial, const double incrementedLegendrePolynomial)
memberdef.name: computeLegendrePolynomialDerivative

briefdescription.para: Compute derivative of unnormalized Legendre polynomial.

detaileddescription.para:
The derivative is computed as: \[ \frac{ \mathrm{ d } P_{ n, m } ( u ) }{ \mathrm{ d } u } = \frac{ \sqrt{ 1 - u ^ 2 } P_{ n, m + 1 }( u ) - m u P_{ n, m }( u ) }{ 1 - u ^ 2 } \] in which $ n $ is the degree, $ m $ is the order, $ u $ is the polynomial parameter, $ P_{ n, m } ( u ) $ is an associated Legendre polynomial, and $ P_{ n, m + 1 } ( u ) $ is an associated Legendre polynomial.
order
Order of requested Legendre polynomial derivative.
polynomialParameter
Free variable of requested Legendre polynomial derivative.
currentLegendrePolynomial
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial with the same degree, order and polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial derivative.
incrementedLegendrePolynomial
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial with the same degree and polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial derivative, but with an order of one more.
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial derivative with respect to the polynomial parameter.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const int order, const double polynomialParameter, const double currentLegendrePolynomial, const double incrementedLegendrePolynomial, const double normalizationCorrection)
memberdef.name: computeGeodesyLegendrePolynomialDerivative

briefdescription.para: Compute derivative of geodesy-normalized associated Legendre polynomial.

detaileddescription.para: Compute derivative of geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial.

Compute derivative of geodesy-normalized associated Legendre polynomial.
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial derivative.
order
Order of requested Legendre polynomial derivative.
polynomialParameter
Free variable of requested Legendre polynomial derivative.
currentLegendrePolynomial
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial with the same degree, order and polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial derivative.
incrementedLegendrePolynomial
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial with the same degree and polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial derivative, but with an order of one more.
normalizationCorrection
Pre-computed scaling term used for part of computations.
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial derivative with respect to the polynomial parameter.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const int order, const double polynomialParameter, const double currentLegendrePolynomial, const double incrementedLegendrePolynomial)
memberdef.name: computeGeodesyLegendrePolynomialDerivative

briefdescription.para: Compute derivative of geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial.

detaileddescription.para:
The derivative is computed as: \[ \frac{ \mathrm{ d } \bar{ P }_{ n, m } ( u ) }{ \mathrm{ d } u } = \sqrt{ \frac{ ( n + m + 1 )( n - m ) }{ ( 1 + \delta_{ 0, m } ) ( 1 - u^2 ) } } \bar{ P }_{ n, m + 1 } - \frac{ m u }{ 1 - u^2 } \bar{ P }_{ n, m } \] in which $ n $ is the degree, $ m $ is the order, $ u $ is the polynomial parameter, $ \delta_{ 0, m } $ is the Kronecker delta, $ P_{ n, m } ( u ) $ is an associated Legendre polynomial, and $ P_{ n, m + 1 } ( u ) $ is an associated Legendre polynomial.
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial derivative.
order
Order of requested Legendre polynomial derivative.
polynomialParameter
Free variable of requested Legendre polynomial derivative.
currentLegendrePolynomial
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial with the same degree, order and polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial derivative.
incrementedLegendrePolynomial
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial with the same degree and polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial derivative, but with an order of one more.
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial derivative with respect to the polynomial parameter.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const int order, const double polynomialParameter)
memberdef.name: computeLegendrePolynomialExplicit

briefdescription.para: Compute low degree/order unnormalized Legendre polynomial explicitly.

detaileddescription.para:
The associated Legendre polynomial $ P_{ n, m }(u) $ with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $ is calculated using explicit formulas given by Eberly [2008]: \begin{eqnarray*} P_{ 0, 0 }( u ) = 1 \\ P_{ 1, 0 }( u ) = u \\ P_{ 1, 1 }( u ) = \sqrt{ 1 - u^2 } \end{eqnarray*} Calculation up to $ n = 1 $ and $ m = 1 $ is supported by this function.
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial.
order
Order of requested Legendre polynomial.
polynomialParameter
Free variable of requested Legendre polynomial.
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const int order, const double polynomialParameter)
memberdef.name: computeGeodesyLegendrePolynomialExplicit

briefdescription.para: Compute low degree/order geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial explicitly.

detaileddescription.para: Compute low degree/order geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomials explicitly.

The normalized associated Legendre polynomial $ \bar{ P }_{ n, m }(u) $ with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $ is calculated using explicit formulas: \begin{eqnarray*} \bar{ P }_{ 0, 0 }( u ) = 1 \\ \bar{ P }_{ 1, 0 }( u ) = \sqrt{ 3 } u \\ \bar{ P }_{ 1, 1 }( u ) = \sqrt{ 3 - 3 u^2 } \end{eqnarray*} Calculation up to $ n = 1 $ and $ m = 1 $ is supported by this function.
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial.
order
Order of requested Legendre polynomial.
polynomialParameter
Free variable of requested Legendre polynomial.
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const double degreeOneOrderOnePolynomial, const double priorSectoralPolynomial)
memberdef.name: computeLegendrePolynomialDiagonal

briefdescription.para: Compute unnormalized Legendre polynomial through sectoral recursion.

detaileddescription.para:
The associated Legendre polynomial $ P_{ n, m }( u ) $ with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $ is calculated through degree recursion as given by Vallado [2001]: \[ P_{ n, m }( u ) = ( 2 n - 1 ) P_{ 1, 1 }( u ) P_{ n - 1, m - 1 }( u ) \]
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial.
degreeOneOrderOnePolynomial
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial with the same polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial, but with a degree and order of one.
priorSectoralPolynomial
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial with the same polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial, but with a degree and order of one less.
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const double degreeOneOrderOnePolynomial, const double priorSectoralPolynomial)
memberdef.name: computeGeodesyLegendrePolynomialDiagonal

briefdescription.para: Compute geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial through sectoral recursion.

detaileddescription.para:
The associated Legendre polynomial $ P_{ n, m }( u ) $ with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $ is calculated through degree recursion as given by Holmes & Featherstone [2002]: \[ \bar{ P }_{ n, m }( u ) = \sqrt{ \frac{ 2 n - 1 }{ 6 n } } \bar{ P }_{ 1, 1 }( u ) \bar{ P }_{ n - 1, m - 1 }( u ) \]
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial.
degreeOneOrderOnePolynomial
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial with the same polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial, but with a degree and order of one.
priorSectoralPolynomial
Legendre polynomial with the same polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial, but with a degree and order of one less.
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const int order, const double polynomialParameter, const double oneDegreePriorPolynomial, const double twoDegreesPriorPolynomial)
memberdef.name: computeLegendrePolynomialVertical

briefdescription.para: Compute unnormalized Legendre polynomial through degree recursion.

detaileddescription.para:
The associated Legendre polynomial $ P_{ n, m }( u ) $ with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $ is calculated through degree recursion as given by Weisstein [2012]: \[ P_{ n, m }( u ) = \frac{ ( 2 n - 1 ) u P_{ n - 1, m }( u ) - ( n + m - 1 ) P_{ n - 2, m }( u ) }{ n - m } \]
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial.
order
Order of requested Legendre polynomial.
polynomialParameter
Free variable of requested Legendre polynomial.
oneDegreePriorPolynomial
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial with the same order and polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial, but with a degree of one less.
twoDegreesPriorPolynomial
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial with the same order and polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial, but with a degree of two less.
Unnormalized Legendre polynomial.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const int order, const double polynomialParameter, const double oneDegreePriorPolynomial, const double twoDegreesPriorPolynomial)
memberdef.name: computeGeodesyLegendrePolynomialVertical

briefdescription.para: Compute geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial through degree recursion.

detaileddescription.para:
The normalized associated Legendre polynomial $ \bar{ P }_{ n, m }( u ) $ with degree $ n $, order $ m $ and polynomial parameter $ u $ is calculated through degree recursion as given by Holmes & Featherstone [2002]: \[ \bar{ P }_{ n, m }( u ) = \sqrt{ \frac{ ( 2 n - 1 )( 2 n + 1 ) }{ ( n - m ) ( n + m ) } } u \bar{ P }_{ n - 1, m }( u ) - \sqrt{ \frac{ ( 2 n + 1 )( n + m - 1 ) ( n - m - 1 ) } { ( n - m)( n + m )( 2 n - 3 ) } } \bar{ P }_{ n - 2, m }( u ) \]
degree
Degree of requested Legendre polynomial.
order
Order of requested Legendre polynomial.
polynomialParameter
Free variable of requested Legendre polynomial.
oneDegreePriorPolynomial
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial with the same polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial, but with a degree of one less.
twoDegreesPriorPolynomial
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial with the same polynomial parameter as the requested Legendre polynomial, but with a degree of two less.
Geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomial.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int degree, const int order)
memberdef.name: calculateLegendreGeodesyNormalizationFactor

briefdescription.para: Function to calculate the normalization factor for Legendre polynomials to geodesy-normalized.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to calculate the normalization factor K_nm to convert regular Legendre polynomials P_nm to geodesy-normalized Legendre polynomials bar{P}_nm, so that bar{P}_nm=K_nm*P_nm. Note that the same conversion for spherical harmonic coefficients from regular to geodesy- normalized requires the inverse factor: 1/K_nm: C_nm=K_nm* bar{C}_nm.
degree
Degree of Legendre polynomial
order
Order of Legendre polynomial
Normalization factor K_nm

briefdescription.para: Nearest left neighbor binary search.

detaileddescription.para:
Searches for the nearest left neighbor in a vector of sorted data using a binary algorithm (Press W.H., et al., 2002).

Vector of data sorted in ascending/descending order.
targetValueInVectorOfSortedData
Target value in vector of sorted data.
Index of nearest left neighbor to target value.

memberdef.name: isIndependentVariableInInterval

briefdescription.para: This function checks whether a value is in a given interval of a sorted vector.

detaileddescription.para:
This function checks whether a value is in a given interval of an STL vector, sorted in ascending order of value of the entries. The interval is identified by the lower index of the entries of the vector defining the interval.
IndependentVariableType
Type of the independent variable values.
lowerIndex
Index of lower bound of interval under consideration.
independentVariableValue
Value of which it is to be checked whether it is in the interval.
independentValues
Vector of values, srted in ascending order.
True if value is in interval, false otherwise.

memberdef.name: findNearestLeftNeighbourUsingHuntingAlgorithm

briefdescription.para: Nearest left leighbour search using hunting algorithm.

detaileddescription.para:
Nearest left leighbour search using hunting algorithm, using an initial guess to decrease the look-up time. Especially useful for long data vectors where the value for which the nearest neighbour is to be found changes slowly w.r.t. the data entries. Implementation is taken from (Press W.H., et al., 2002). Algorithm is at worst twice as slow as binary search and can be orders of magnitude faster in suitable cases.
IndependentVariableType
Type for entries of vector of in which nearest neighbour is sought.
independentVariableValue
Value of which the nearest left neighbour is to be calculated.
previousNearestLowerIndex_
Initial guess of nearest lft neighbour.
independentValues_
Vector of independent variables, sorted in ascending order, in which the nearest left (lower) neighbour is to be determined.
Index of independentValues_ that is the nearest left neighbour

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector3d &originOfRotation, const double angleOfRotation, const Eigen::Vector3d &axisOfRotation, const Eigen::Vector3d &initialPositionOfPoint)
memberdef.name: computeRotationOfPointAboutArbitraryAxis

briefdescription.para: Compute rotation of point about arbitrary axis.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the rotation of a point about an arbitrary axis. This function computes the position of the rotated point by computing the displacement vector between the origin of rotation and the initalPosition of point and then applying a matrix as shown in section 6 of http://inside.mines.edu/~gmurray/ArbitraryAxisRotation/ArbitraryAxisRotation.html. A visualization of the computation being performed can be found at http://twist-and-shout.appspot.com/. Units for originOfRotation, and initialPositionOfPoint must be the same. All positions are assumed to be with respect to a common arbitrary origin. Note that this arbitrary origin is not necessarily the origin of rotation.
originOfRotation
Position of tail of axis of rotation vector with respect to a chosen arbitrary origin.
angleOfRotation
Angle about which the point rotates with respect to the axis of rotation [rad].
axisOfRotation
Unit vector pointed in the direction of rotation determined by the right-hand rule.
initialPositionOfPoint
Position of point before rotation with respect to the same chosen arbitrary origin.
Position of point after rotation about the axis of rotation with respect to the same chosen arbitrary origin.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector3d &originOfRotation, const double angleOfRotation, const Eigen::Vector3d &axisOfRotation, const Eigen::Vector3d &initialPositionOfVectorTail, const Eigen::Vector3d &initialVector)
memberdef.name: computeRotationOfVectorAboutArbitraryAxis

briefdescription.para: Compute rotation of vector about an arbitrary axis.

detaileddescription.para: Compute rotation of vector about arbitrary axis.

Computes rotation of vector about an arbitrary axis. This function uses computeRotationOfPointAboutArbitraryAxis to rotate the position of the head and tail of the vector and compute the resultant vector defined as the difference of the two rotated points. Units for originOfRotation, initialPositionOfVectorTail and initialVector must be the same.
originOfRotation
Position of tail of axis of rotation vector with respect to a chosen arbitrary origin.
angleOfRotation
Angle over which the vector is rotated. A positive angle is determined using the right hand rule [rad].
axisOfRotation
Unit vector pointing in the direction of rotation determined by the right-hand rule.
initialPositionOfVectorTail
Initial position of tail of vector which will be rotated with respect to this same chosen arbitrary origin.
initialVector
Vector to be rotated with respect to this same chosen arbitrary origin.
Vector after rotation about the arbitrary axis with respect to this same chosen arbitrary origin.
computeRotationOfPointAboutArbitraryAxis.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector3d &eulerAngles)
memberdef.name: getQuaternionFrom313EulerAngles

briefdescription.para: Get quaternion from associated 3-1-3 Euler angles.

detaileddescription.para:
Get quaternion q from 3-1-3 Euler angles set. That is, the Euler angles x, y, z are defined such that the associated rotation matrix R = R_{3}(x)R_{1}(y)R_{3}(z)
eulerAngles
Euler angles for which the equivalent quaternion is to be computed.
Quaternion defining same rotation as Euler angles

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Matrix3d &rotationMatrix)
memberdef.name: get132EulerAnglesFromRotationMatrix

briefdescription.para: Get classical 1-3-2 Euler angles set from rotation matrix.

detaileddescription.para:
Get classical 1-3-2 Euler angles set from rotation matrix R. That is, the Euler angles x, y, z are returned such that R = R_{1}(x)R_{3}(y)R_{2}(z)
rotationMatrix
Rotation matrix for which the equivalent Euler angles are to be computed.
Euler angles x,y,z (about 1, 3 and 2 axes, respectively).

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Quaterniond &quaternion)
memberdef.name: get313EulerAnglesFromQuaternion

briefdescription.para: Get classical 3-1-3 Euler angles set from quaternion.

detaileddescription.para:
Get classical 3-1-3 Euler angles set from quaternion q. That is, the Euler angles x, y, z are returned such that the associated rotation matrix R = R_{3}(x)R_{1}(y)R_{3}(z)
quaternion
Quaternion for which the equivalent Euler angles are to be computed.
Euler angles x,y,z (about 3, 1 and 3 axes, respectively).

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Matrix3d &rotationMatrix)

Get classical 3-1-3 Euler angles set from rotation matrix R. That is, the Euler angles x, y, z are returned such that R = R_{3}(x)R_{1}(y)R_{3}(z)
rotationMatrix
Rotation matrix for which the equivalent Euler angles are to be computed.
Euler angles x,y,z (about 3, 1 and 3 axes, respectively).

memberdef.argsstring: (const double distance, const double radiusPowerTerm, const double cosineOfOrderLongitude, const double sineOfOrderLongitude, const double cosineOfLatitude, const double preMultiplier, const int degree, const int order, const double cosineHarmonicCoefficient, const double sineHarmonicCoefficient, const double legendrePolynomial, const double legendrePolynomialDerivative)
memberdef.name: computePotentialGradient

briefdescription.para: Compute the gradient of a single term of a spherical harmonics potential field.

detaileddescription.para:
This function returns a vector with the derivatives of a generic potential field (defined by spherical harmonics) from pre-computed quatities.
distance
Distance to center of body with gravity field at which the potential gradient is to be calculated
radiusPowerTerm
Distance divided by the reference radius of the gravity field, to the power (degree + 1)
cosineOfOrderLongitude
Cosine of order times the longitude at which the potential is to be calculated
sineOfOrderLongitude
Sine of order times the longitude at which the potential is to be calculated
cosineOfLatitude
Cosine of the latitude at which the potential is to be calculated
preMultiplier
Generic multiplication factor.
degree
Degree of the harmonic for which the gradient is to be computed.
order
Order of the harmonic for which the gradient is to be computed.
cosineHarmonicCoefficient
Coefficient which characterizes relative strengh of a harmonic term.
sineHarmonicCoefficient
Coefficient which characterizes relative strengh of a harmonic term.
legendrePolynomial
Value of associated Legendre polynomial with the same degree and order as the to be computed harmonic, and with the sine of the latitude coordinate as polynomial parameter. Make sure that the Legendre polynomial has the same normalization as the harmonic coefficients.
legendrePolynomialDerivative
Value of the derivative of parameter 'legendrePolynomial' with respect to the sine of the latitude angle.
Vector with derivatives of potential field. The order is important! gradient( 0 ) = derivative with respect to radial distance, gradient( 1 ) = derivative with respect to latitude angle, gradient( 2 ) = derivative with respect to longitude angle.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector3d &sphericalPosition, const double referenceRadius, const double preMultiplier, const int degree, const int order, const double cosineHarmonicCoefficient, const double sineHarmonicCoefficient, const double legendrePolynomial, const double legendrePolynomialDerivative)

detaileddescription.para:
This function returns a vector with the derivatives of a generic potential field (defined by spherical harmonics). *
sphericalPosition
Vector with spherical coordinates. The order is important! sphericalPosition( 0 ) = radial coordinate, sphericalPosition( 1 ) = latitude coordinate, sphericalPosition( 2 ) = longitude coordinate.
referenceRadius
Radius of harmonics reference sphere.
preMultiplier
Generic multiplication factor.
degree
Degree of the harmonic for which the gradient is to be computed.
order
Order of the harmonic for which the gradient is to be computed.
cosineHarmonicCoefficient
Coefficient which characterizes relative strengh of a harmonic term.
sineHarmonicCoefficient
Coefficient which characterizes relative strengh of a harmonic term.
legendrePolynomial
Value of associated Legendre polynomial with the same degree and order as the to be computed harmonic, and with the sine of the latitude coordinate as polynomial parameter. Make sure that the Legendre polynomial has the same normalization as the harmonic coefficients.
legendrePolynomialDerivative
Value of the derivative of parameter 'legendrePolynomial' with respect to the sine of the latitude angle.
Vector with derivatives of potential field. The order is important! gradient( 0 ) = derivative with respect to radial distance, gradient( 1 ) = derivative with respect to latitude angle, gradient( 2 ) = derivative with respect to longitude angle.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector3d &sphericalPosition, const double preMultiplier, const int degree, const int order, const double cosineHarmonicCoefficient, const double sineHarmonicCoefficient, const double legendrePolynomial, const double legendrePolynomialDerivative, const std::shared_ptr< SphericalHarmonicsCache > sphericalHarmonicsCache)
memberdef.name: computePotentialGradient

briefdescription.para: Compute the gradient of a single term of a spherical harmonics potential field.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns a vector with the derivatives of a generic potential field (defined by spherical harmonics). It is assumed that the potential field of a single harmonic is characterized by: \[ U = A \left( \frac{ R }{ r} \right) ^{ n + 1} P _{ n, m } ( \sin \phi ) \left[ C _{ n, m } \cos( m \lambda ) + S _{ n, m } \sin( \lambda ) \right] \] in which $ A $ is the generic multiplication factor, $ R $ is the radius of the harmonics reference sphere, $ P _{ n, m }( \sin \phi ) $ is the associated Legendre polynomial with $ \sin \phi $ as polynomial parameter, $ r $ is the radial coordinate, $ \phi $ is the latitude coordinate, $ \lambda $ is the longitude coordinate, $ n $ is the harmonics degree, $ m $ is the harmonics order, $ C _{ n, m } $ is the cosine harmonics coefficient, and $ S _{ n, m } $ is the sine harmonics coefficient.

The potential derivatives are calculated through: \begin{eqnarray*} \frac{ \mathrm{ d } U }{ \mathrm{ d } r } = -\frac{ A }{ r } \left( \frac{ R }{ r } \right) ^{ n + 1 } ( n + 1 ) P_{ n, m }( \sin \phi )[ C_{ n, m } \cos( m \lambda ) + S_{ n,m } \sin( m \lambda ) ] \\ \frac{ \mathrm{ d } U }{ \mathrm{ d } \phi } = A \left( \frac{ R }{ r } \right)^{ n + 1 } \frac{ \mathrm{ d } [ P( \sin \phi ) ] }{ \mathrm{ d } [ \sin \phi ] } \cos \phi [ C_{ n, m } \cos( m \lambda ) + S_{ n, m } \sin( m \lambda ) ] \\ \frac{ \mathrm{ d } U }{ \mathrm{ d } \lambda } = A \left( \frac{ R }{ r } \right)^{ n + 1 } m P_{ n, m }( \sin \phi ) [ S_{ n, m } \cos( m \lambda ) - C_{ n, m } \sin( m \lambda ) ] \end{eqnarray*}

parameterdescription.para: Vector with spherical coordinates. The order is important! sphericalPosition( 0 ) = radial coordinate, sphericalPosition( 1 ) = latitude coordinate, sphericalPosition( 2 ) = longitude coordinate.
Generic multiplication factor.
Degree of the harmonic for which the gradient is to be computed.
Order of the harmonic for which the gradient is to be computed.
Coefficient which characterizes relative strengh of a harmonic term.
Coefficient which characterizes relative strengh of a harmonic term.

Value of associated Legendre polynomial with the same degree and order as the to be computed harmonic, and with the sine of the latitude coordinate as polynomial parameter. Make sure that the Legendre polynomial has the same normalization as the harmonic coefficients.
Value of the derivative of parameter 'legendrePolynomial' with respect to the sine of the latitude angle.
Cache object containing current values of trigonometric funtions of latitude anf longitude, as well as legendre polynomials at current state.

simplesect.para: Vector with derivatives of potential field. The order is important! gradient( 0 ) = derivative with respect to radial distance, gradient( 1 ) = derivative with respect to latitude angle, gradient( 2 ) = derivative with respect to longitude angle.
